intro: Sophia incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sophia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
